DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Docusate Preventing/Treating Constipation Palliative Care Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Palliative patient frequently experience constipation due multiple factor - structural abnormality , medication , metabolic disturbance , neurological disorder , general condition . Docusate stool softener widely use , combination stimulate laxative , prevent treat constipation palliative care patient . In past decade controversy effectiveness population , control trial conduct use docusate palliative patient . The purpose study assess effectiveness docusate prevent treat constipation palliative care patient . The study design randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled trial compare current standard treatment ( docusate combination laxative , sennoside ) sennoside laxative alone . A total 70 patient ( 35 group ) recruit Palliative Care Unit St. Joseph 's Auxiliary Care Hospital , Mel Miller Hospice Edmonton General Continuing Care Hospital , CapitalCare Norwood Edmonton , Alberta , Canada . Patients must ≥ 18 year age , able take oral medication , without difficulty swallowing , palliative performance ≥ 20 % , stoma . The duration treatment 10 day . The main outcome measure include bowel frequency , stool consistency , intervention ( suppository , enema ) , difficulty defecating , sense inability evacuate completely . This study provide insight effectiveness docusate prevent treat constipation palliative patient care family physician specialize palliative care provider . If docusate find added benefit , potential enhance quality life palliative care patient reduce number medication take reduce palliative care team 's ( e.g . nursing ) workload cost .
